messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] sixties/rush
messages.msgSnippet: *SOME* people grow and learn, others tread water.  It would seem that we are getting a recycled Gulf War, all the same players, all the same reasons. Only
messages.messageBody:
*SOME* people grow and learn, others tread water. It would seem that we are
getting a recycled Gulf War, all the same players, all the same reasons.
Only difference would be that this time the fallout of the money brokers/oil
barrons' gread is that death has appeared on our doorstep.

Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: Wendy Silver <wew99@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, October 31, 2001 1:49 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] sixties/rush


> where did you get your info on what protestors had at Kent State? All of
> the government agencies even admit that the shooting didn't start from the
> protestors. And, all the stuff they were suppose to be carrying sounds
like
> government propaganda to excuse their actions.
> I know people that were there and one of them got injured by a cement cup,
> but dodged a bag of sh--.
> A nurse friend of my family happened to be the one to clean up the murder
> victim.
>
> Hey, I never said that Rush was credible, lets just get that cleared up
> immediately. Although, his facts have some truths as do the G. W. facts.
For
> every "fact" there is another side and a debate. As far as good things he
> has done, I am not sure at this point, because
> I seem to be more focused on the things that I don't want him to do.
>
> "And what kind of nonsense was your last sentence "if there was a point
> other
> than to cause human injury."
>
> Sorry,you are right, sounds like nonsense,
> but I don't sit here alone with my thoughts, and there is a constant
> interruption.
> Not everything comes out as eloquently as I would like.
> However, I don't think there is a point to harping about someone's alleged
> shortcomings, and I don't think he is as short on intelligence as the spin
> machines claim. Even if some of the reports are complete facts. I don't
> believe that he would intestinally make thousands of underprivileged
people
> suffer; I don't believe that grades have any correlation with
> intelligence.
> I don't even know how anyone could prove truth to the 34 million in lost
> aide.
> Did he not sign it because he didn't show up for work? Did he disagree
with
> the plan? Is this information coming from a credible source?
> Do you know George Bush's friend that bailed out George W.? Why would
> someone want to bail out a son of a friend unless they thought they were
> getting some sort of deal? My dad has some wealthy friends, and although
> they like my dad, they don't have any interest in spreading that wealth my
> way,or bailing me out when I need it.
> I do prefer politicians that have some real business experience, not just
> learned theories even if the experience is considered a failure, because
> people grow and learn from "failing".
>
> Wendy

messages.subject: sixties/rush
messages.msgSnippet: where did you get your info on what protestors had at Kent State?  All of the government agencies even admit that the shooting didn t start from the
messages.messageBody:
where did you get your info on what protestors had at Kent State? All of
the government agencies even admit that the shooting didn't start from the
protestors. And, all the stuff they were suppose to be carrying sounds like
government propaganda to excuse their actions.
I know people that were there and one of them got injured by a cement cup,
but dodged a bag of sh--.
A nurse friend of my family happened to be the one to clean up the murder
victim.

Hey, I never said that Rush was credible, lets just get that cleared up
immediately. Although, his facts have some truths as do the G. W. facts. For
every "fact" there is another side and a debate. As far as good things he
has done, I am not sure at this point, because
I seem to be more focused on the things that I don't want him to do.

"And what kind of nonsense was your last sentence "if there was a point
other
than to cause human injury."

Sorry,you are right, sounds like nonsense,
but I don't sit here alone with my thoughts, and there is a constant
interruption.
Not everything comes out as eloquently as I would like.
However, I don't think there is a point to harping about someone's alleged
shortcomings, and I don't think he is as short on intelligence as the spin
machines claim. Even if some of the reports are complete facts. I don't
believe that he would intestinally make thousands of underprivileged people
suffer; I don't believe that grades have any correlation with
intelligence.
I don't even know how anyone could prove truth to the 34 million in lost
aide.
Did he not sign it because he didn't show up for work? Did he disagree with
the plan? Is this information coming from a credible source?
Do you know George Bush's friend that bailed out George W.? Why would
someone want to bail out a son of a friend unless they thought they were
getting some sort of deal? My dad has some wealthy friends, and although
they like my dad, they don't have any interest in spreading that wealth my
way,or bailing me out when I need it.
I do prefer politicians that have some real business experience, not just
learned theories even if the experience is considered a failure, because
people grow and learn from "failing".

Wendy
